title: Daily Evening Bhagavatam Discourse | HH Stoka Krishna Swami | SB 1.13.26-27 | 9-10-2022
speaker: HH Stoka Krishna Swami

segments.text: Om Agyana Timiran Dhasya Gyananjani Shalakaya
Chaksharan Militam Yena Tasmai Shri Gurave Namaha
Nama Om Vishnu Padaya Krishna Preshtaya Bhutale
Shri Mate Bhakti Vedanta Swamin Nithinamine
Namaste Saraswate Deve Gauravani Pracharine
Nirvishesha Shunyavadi Pashchatya Deshatarine
Jaya Shri Krishna Chaitanya Prabhu Nithyananda
Shri Advaita Gadadhara Srivasadi Gaurabhakta Vrinda
Hare Krishna Hare Krishna Krishna Krishna Hare Hare
Hare Rama Hare Rama Rama Rama Hare Hare
Om Namo Bhagavate Vasudevaya Narayanam Namaskritya
Naram Jai Vanarottamam Devim Saraswati Vyasam
Tato Jayam Udi Rayet
In this session we will be discussing from two verses
the 26th and the 27th verses
of the Shri Advaitha Gadadhara Shri Vasadi Gauravakta Vrinda
of the 13th chapter of the first canto of Shri Madbhagavatam
the 26th verse
Gata Swartham Imam Deham
Virakto Mukta Bandhanaha
Avignyata Gatir Jahyat
Savay Dheera Udah Hruthaha
So far Vidura has been describing the condition of the Trashtra
which is a miserable condition
a degraded life is leading
not preparing himself for death
now he is giving a practical solution
what should the Trashtra do
he has already told him quit home
leave home immediately and do what
that is going to come in the next few verses
so this 26th verse the meaning is
he is called undisturbed
undisturbed means Dheera
who goes to an unknown remote place
and freed from all obligations
quits his material body
when it has become useless
so what is the meaning of this
going to a remote unknown place
and quitting the material body
when one has
when the body has become useless
that is explained by Srila Prabhupada
in the purport
Narottam Das Thakur
a great devotee and acharya
of the Gaudiya Vaishnava sect
has sung
Narottam Das Thakur
my lord
I have simply wasted my life
having obtained the human body
I have neglected to worship your lordship
and therefore
I have willingly drunk poison
this is a part of a song
written by Srila Narottam Das Thakur
one of the previous acharyas
so Srila Prabhupada explains
in other words
the human body is especially meant
for cultivating knowledge of devotion
and service to the Lord
without which life becomes full of anxieties
and miserable conditions
therefore
one who has spoiled his life
without such cultural activities
is advised to leave home
without knowledge of friends and relatives
and being thus freed from all obligations
of family, society, country, etc.
give up the body at some unknown destination
so that others may not know
where and how he has met his destiny
where and how he has met his death
this is the recommendation
for somebody who has not taken up
devotional service
to fully engage in devotional service
at the time of old age
before death comes
is the best remedy for facing death
and achieving perfection of the human form of life
but if somebody, let us say, is in the middle of death,
but if somebody, let us say, is in the middle of death,
but if somebody, let us say, is in the middle of death,
but if somebody, let us say, is in the middle of death,
has not practiced, not prepared that way
then better to quit home
without knowledge of friends and relatives
in such a way that one may give up the body
in some unknown place
and without the knowledge of anyone else
so Srila Prabhupada further explains
dhira means one who is not disturbed
even when there is sufficient provocation
even when there is sufficient provocation
even when there is sufficient provocation
one cannot give up a comfortable family life
due to his affectionate relationship
with wife and children
self-realization is obstructed
by such undue affection for family
and if anyone is at all able to forget such a relation
he is called undisturbed or dhira
to be able to forget that bond of affection
for family members
and thereby
and thereby

Quit home is possible only for a dhira. Dhira means undisturbed. This is however the path of renunciation based on a frustrated life is for those who are unable to take to devotional service and are experiencing the miserable conditions especially in old age.

But Srila Prabhupada says this is a recommendation of accepting the path of renunciation based on frustrated life. But stabilization of such renunciation is possible only by association with bona fide saints and self-realized souls by which one can be engaged in the loving devotional service of the Lord.
So what is Prabhupada saying here? That you may accept the path of renunciation giving up the miserable condition of material existence based on experiencing frustration living such a miserable life.
But you cannot become stable and fixed up in that renounced life.
Simply by going away from home and remaining undisturbed. No. You have to positively engage in pure devotional service under the guidance of pure devotees like Vidura.
Sincere surrender unto the lotus feet of the Lord is possible by awakening the transcendental sense of service.
This is called awakening of the divine sense of service.
This is called awakening of the divine sense of service.
This is made possible by association with pure devotees of the Lord.
Sadhu Sangha.
Dhritarashtra was lucky enough to have a brother whose very association was a source of liberation for his frustrated life.
So Dhritarashtra was very very fortunate because Vidura specially came to the palace of Hastinapura to deliver Vidura.
To deliver Dhritarashtra.
In the twenty-seventh verse further instructions are being given by Vidura to Dhritarashtra.
Twenty-seventh verse is as follows.

and understands either by himself or from others the falsity and misery of this material
world and thus leaves home and depends fully on the personality of Godhead residing within
his heart so the best course of action for somebody like Dhritarashtra is not simply
to leave home and go away to an unknown place but rather understand the falsity of this
material existence by becoming enlightened by hearing from such pure devotees like Vidura
and

and leaves home depending completely on the personality of Godhead who resides in his

Knowledge or understanding for all of us. Krishna resides in our heart is Paramatma.
Everybody's heart. And he is always there. So he is our top most well wisher. He is our
best guide. He is most dependable. He is always ready to enlighten us, to guide us, to protect
us, to give us strength. So leave home depending.
So, Srila Pravapada says the idea is that the renounced order of life after a
frustrated life of sentiment in the material world may be the stepping stone on the path
of self-realization. But real perfection of the path of liberation is attained when one
is practiced to depend fully on the personality of Godhead who lives in everyone's heart,
as Paramatma so it is necessary for everyone regardless of how they plan to
quit household life and enter spiritual life regardless of that everyone should
prepare themselves to depend fully on Krishna within the heart by learning
this from an expert devotee learning this from an expert devotee so Srila

Prabhupada is giving us directions. If at all you want to be able to fully depend
on Krishna towards the end of your life, then prepare, begin preparation for it
now by associating with devotees and practicing chanting, hearing about
Krishna's holy name, Krishna's qualities, Krishna's pastimes described in the
Bhagavatam, etc. Prepare yourself by this practice and then Krishna will actually
guide you, help you, Krishna will purify you and you can actually seriously take up
Krishna consciousness in this way. One who desires material benefit by such
devotional activities can never depend on God consciousness.
one who desires material benefits by electing Kristina's material benefits
will depend on the Supreme Personality of Godhead although the Supreme Lord is
seated in everyone's heart as Paramarckim. So to actually depend on Krishna means
never to accept any material benefits from devotional service.
The materialistic devotees, who are materialistic devotees, they want the material benefit by doing a devotional service.
They may be blessed by the Lord with material benefits. They may beまだì statistic, dar o an Christians tar爸 jo tar.
but they cannot reach the stage of the first-class human being as above mentioned.
So it is best to practice devotional service before quitting home or before the death comes
and having practiced actually execute devotional service depending on Krishna in all circumstances
and thereby perfecting one's life. I'll stop here. Thank you very much. Hare Krishna.
